body.p:
It may appear strange to you
to be troubled with my correspondence, but there
are times in a man's life, which prompt him
to do that which at other times he would not, this
is the case with me. I am ready to make any
sacrifices to illicit truth. Truth is my motto
I have long had reason to feel very angry
at your conduct towards me. from the very hour
I set my foot on the American Shore you
openly declared yourself my opponent—you
wrote and spoke against me, and you did
more you vilified and maligned my public
and private character, and would if you
could have injured my prospects in this free
Country—my ability and Talents as a Teacher
of God's word you could not defy for in that
respect my name of old stands high in the
List—and the people will judge for themselves
& came therefore to the conclusion that it was
in your part as well as others of the Clergy
nothing else but jealousy in a literary point
of view, and to crush me was the main object
of all your proceedings—but it happily failed!

p.rend: The following is written in pencil at the bottom left of the page.

body.p:
2) wish there few remarks which you see are candid on
my part—let me notice in the first instance, that
up to the present Hour I cannot unravel the
mystery why you should have so inveterate an
objection to me. I often ask myself the question
what can the reason be? I have never harmed
Mr Leeser, nor have I thought I could do so—
In looking at your letter to me of Sept 5612 which
breathes a spirit of kindness and good feeling, and
the amicable disposition with which we met each
at the חנוך at Syracuse, where I officiated as
חזן Dr Raphale preached—I cannot but be
astonished at the Report you spread of me when
I met you at Charleston in the following Winter
when that Report reached me, knowing that I care
defy the whole world as to my character of the
truth be adhered to I lost no time in sending
without delay to Europe all that you said of me
in the name of Dr Raphale and by the next
mail I received a Document from the בית דין
of London proving at once all such Reports to
be false—and while yet at Charleston I wrote to
Dr Raphale calling upon him to state which
he know of me, and to say why He did report
those things which you said came from him
copy of the said letter was handed over to Mr
Hart the פרנס of the קהלה there—but he deigned not
to answer it. I wrote a second—and the result
was the same—I wrote a third in which I

used דברים קשים and this ended in a reply written
in Hebrew throughout of an evasive character
and flatly denying any thing ever having been
said by him to any one—now I ask you what
is all this from men who are placed at the
Head of Congregations to level there Religion
and Moralists—who am I to believe?—
the letter I have in my possession which you
can have whenever you please—copies of all
the letters and Documents I sent to Charleston
Letters to and fro passed between us but were
unsatisfactory in their result—

Many many persons here in this City and in
Syracuse urged me to indict you for slander
in order to ascertain who was the real author
of the Report—I would not—for state litigation
especially between the Clergy—we are low enough
already and for the love of my Religion I would
not be led on to such a course. I had hoped
to have been in a position long ere this to
have learned who was the aggressor in this
matter. Having met you here on some occasins
I feign would have asked you, but my Head
told me הרחק משכן רע for such I held you, &
you could not blame me, for when I reflect that
you had no feeling for an innocent man, who
had a large family to support, and by your
villainous Report I might have starved with them

Had not the God of Israel been to me לעזר
truly did I say with the sweet Psalmist of
Israel ה' לי לא אירא, מה יעשה לי אדם
In spite of all my enemies, I have proved to the
American Jews that I am what I represent myself
to be a true Orthodox Israelite, capable of filling
any office to which I may be appointed—and I
can without fear challenge any of the Ministers
throughout the United States in point of ability
and Competency for a Jewish Divine—and they
are now satisfied beyond doubt—that all those
who attempted to injured me are none else
but Mountebanks and Hypocrites do not my
friend think me harsh but “אמת יורה דרכו”
Now I ask you is it not due to me, that
you should give me up your author of
the Report you spread about me at Charleston
you said there it was Dr Raphale. He denies
it, and when he was asked about me two
years since when I had a call to this City
His reply was, Report speaks to? of me, and
you knew all about it. but I believe that
He himself was the calumniator, for I have
had reason to think so since that time—and when
I wrote to Mr Sevien of Charleston, He stated He
was sure you would make the amende Honorable
if you were the aggressor. Now if you are

not the guilty party why you should still be
thought so by me לך בדרך הישר ועשה הטוב, אמת ומשפט עשה בין ארץ לחבירו, ולא תגור מפני
איש כי המשפט לאלהים הוא, והוא יבקש את נרדף
ה' ישלם לך פעלך והיית נקי פה ומישראל
I have no desire to make any public use of it
but I am anxious to know the Truth for I
have never since that time spoken to Dr Raphale
for I hold it dangerous until I am set to
right in the matter. I must not omit the
Circumstance you witnessed at Syracuse at
the festival where the Dr spoke of me in such
commendable terms—I know you stated this
at Charleston—but you should first have
asked me, and I could have assured you to
the contrary—again I have a letter in my
possession sent by the Dr to Louisville in my
behalf which contradicts all he said to you
about me—Now I leave the matter in
your hands whether you think we should
remain open and severe enemies for
life, or whether you will do me the justice to
set the matter at issue by declaring to me
the truth throughout אני שלום וכי אדבר המה מלחמה
—אם לא יגיד ונשא עוני
I shall be willing to return you any favor
you may desire of me as far as I am able
in my public capacity—my whole time is
devoted for the benefit of my people—you no doubt
read the Asmonean, and see my articles

against Dr Wise's Heterodoxy—his learning
I do not fear—nor do I hold back in
speaking out my mind. How many of our
Divines do you see fight the Battles of the Lord
some are afraid that their own character may
be involved and others are too ignorant
I know them all—and they know me too
and therefore as King David said
“תורת משה”

These men can go to public Dinner and
spout a studied speech upon an old
hackneyed subject.
and the public are gulled
by them because they can flatter and act
the Sycophant, I do not, and must confess
you do not, as your Journal proves—
situated as I am at present I have nothing
to fear from any of these men—now if
you consider me worthy your Confidence
in informing me of the truth—I shall feel
satisfied so that I may not attach any
Blame to the innocent—כ"ד ספרי קודש
this will enable us both to meet in the
Square and when this matter shall be
amicably adjusted, I shall be ever ready
to serve you in writing for your Journal.

p.rend: The following is written in pencil at the bottom of the page.

body.p:
that is if you deem me capable. I have
an extensive Hebrew library which will
enable me at any time to refer to any
scarce rule or passage in Holy writ? you
may require, and that shall be at your
Service, and in that confidence between
man and man—and I shall be ready to
assist you in your Holy work by such
means to put down those who rise up to
undermine our Holy Religion, and revile
the Word of God as contained in מבקש האמת ודורש הטוב לכל אדם וד"ל די לחכימא
and the whole Hebrew.

In conclusion permit me to say, that whatever
may be your determination in the matter
I shall solace myself with the reflection that
I have done my duty both to you and
to myself.

Wishing you success in all
you laudable undertakings
